events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred on the morning of May 1st, causing significant front bumper damage and airbag deployment.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to vehicle collision and related damages.
A claims agent was assigned to manage the case and coordinate with the policyholder for further process.
The insured was notified that their claim has been acknowledged and will be handled as per policy guidelines.
Request sent for accident police report, vehicle photographs, and repair estimates to further verify the damage claim.
The insured submitted all requested documents including police report, photos of the damaged car, and a mechanic's repair estimate.
An investigation began to verify claim details, damage authenticity, and to assess liability for the auto accident.
Investigation confirmed the details of the accident as reported; damages match repair estimates and liability accepted.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the full cost of repairs and car rental during the vehicle's downtime.
The insured provided positive feedback on the prompt handling and clear communication throughout the claims process.
The claim was officially approved by management and all settlement terms were confirmed with the policyholder.
Payment for the approved claim was issued to the insured's account to cover vehicle repairs and incidental expenses.
The claim was formally closed after confirmation that all payments were received and the insured was satisfied.
